ws.rocket.config.reader

Class ReaderContext<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws.rocket.config.reader.ReaderContext<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - Target bean type.

    public final class ReaderContext<T>
extends Object
    Provides a helpful context binding all the needed components to simplify stream parsing process. Mainly this class provides methods to remember the current section, to provide enhanced logging methods, and access to current stream reader and target bean writer.
    Author:
    Martti Tamm

      Creates a new reader context.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReaderContext

        public ReaderContext(BeanContext<T> beanFactory,
             boolean emptyConstructor,
             InputStream input)
              throws ConfigException
        Creates a new reader context.
        Parameters:
        beanFactory - The target bean handler.
        emptyConstructor - A Boolean indicating that the bean must support default constructor.
        input - The stream to parse (fails if null).
        Throws:
        ConfigException - When there are problems with stream or configuration file syntax/data.

    • Method Detail

      • toNextSection

        public ReaderContext<T> toNextSection()
                               throws IOException
        Reads configuration file until a section declaration is reached. After this method completes, the stream can be used to read the contents of the section.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.
        Throws:
        IOException - When underlying stream has problems.

      • inSection

        public String inSection()
        Provides the section name (without square brackets) or null when no section declaration has been read or when end of stream is reached.
        Returns:
        The current section name or null.

      • inSection

        public ReaderContext<T> inSection(String name)
        Updates the current section name with the given name (with square brackets). Usually the name parameter corresponds to a line that begins with a square bracket. Therefore the parameter value may also be null.
        Parameters:
        name - The line containing section name. May be null.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.

      • error

        public ReaderContext<T> error(String msg)
        Logs an error message. This method will also add information about current section and line number to the message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.

      • warn

        public ReaderContext<T> warn(String msg)
        Logs a warning message. This method will also add information about current section and line number to the message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to log.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.

      • log

        public ReaderContext<T> log(SectionValueException e)
        Logs a value conversion exception. This method will also add information about current section and line number to the message.
        Parameters:
        e - The exception to log.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.

      • log

        public ReaderContext<T> log(String when,
                   IOException e)
        Logs an exception regarding the underlying stream.
        Parameters:
        when - A description when this message occurred.
        e - The exception to log.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.

      • checkErrors

        public ReaderContext<T> checkErrors()
                             throws ConfigException
        Checks that there are no error messages logged. If there is any, this method will raise a ConfigException to view the logged messages.
        Returns:
        Current reader context.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - When there are problems with the configuration file.

      • getStreamReader

        public StreamReader getStreamReader()
        Provides access to the current configuration file stream reader.
        Returns:
        A stream reader.

      • getBeanWriter

        public BeanWriter<T> getBeanWriter()
        Provides access to the current target bean writer.
        Returns:
        A bean writer.
